00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 contextTF.pl - Imlements contexts for true/false problems.
00020 
00021 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00022 
00023 Implements contexts for string-valued answers especially
00024 for matching problems (where you match against T and F).
00025 
00026     Context("TF");
00027 
00028 You can add new strings to the context as needed (or remove old ones)
00029 via the Context()->strings->add() and Context()-strings->remove()
00030 methods.
00031 
00032 Use:
00033 
00034     ANS(string_cmp("T","F"));
00035 
00036 when there are two answers, the first being "T" and the second being "F".
00037 
00038 =cut
00039 
00040 loadMacros("MathObjects.pl","contextString.pl");
00041 
00042 sub _contextTF_init {
00043 
00044   my $context = $main::context{TF} = Parser::Context->getCopy("String");
00045   $context->{name} = "TF";
00046   $context->strings->are(
00047     "T" => {value => 1},
00048     "F" => {value => 0},
00049     "True" => {alias => "T"},
00050     "False" => {alias => "F"},
00051   );
00052 
00053   main::Context("TF");  ### FIXME:  probably should require author to set this explicitly
00054 }
00055 
00056 1;
